column4: Tourism;Siem Reap: Almost a year to the day that first flights began from Siem Reap to Phnom Penh and Siem Reap
column5: the Cambodian subsidiary of Lithuanian airline Small Planet has ceased operations.------Staff complain they have not been paid for over 6 weeks
column6: and two Airbus A320-200s remain parked on the tarmac in Siem Reap. The company has told employees
column7: that while the European side of the operation has been greatly reduced
column8: they are hoping for an investor to step in and save the Cambodian business.------Further details  are currently unknown
column9: as the company refuses to comment.------*Source
column11: and an article published in German media over a week ago
column12: but strangely nothing (that we have seen) in the local press.------http://www.austrianaviation.net/detail/grounding-bei-small-planet-kambodscha/------
